original: Aṇḍajā nāgā, jalābujā nāgā, saṁsedajā nāgā, opapātikā nāgā.🔽Tatra, bhikkhave, aṇḍajehi nāgehi jalābujā ca saṁsedajā ca opapātikā ca nāgā paṇītatarā.🔽Tatra, bhikkhave, aṇḍajehi ca jalābujehi ca nāgehi saṁsedajā ca opapātikā ca nāgā paṇītatarā.
analyzed: aṇḍa jāḥ nāgāḥ jalābu jāḥ nāgāḥ sa seda jāḥ nāgāḥ opapātikāḥ nāgāḥ  tatra bhikkhave aṇḍa jehi nāgehi jalābu jā ca saseda jā ca opapātikā ca nāgā paṇītatarā  tatra bhikkhave aṇḍa jehi ca jalābu jehi ca nāgehi saseda jā ca opapātikā ca nāgā paṇītatarā
translated: Nāgas born from eggs, nāgas born from the womb, nāgas born from warmth and moisture, and spontaneously born nāgas.🔽Among them, nāgas born from warmth and moisture and spontaneously born nāgas are finer than nāgas born from eggs and nāgas born from the womb.

original: Tatra, bhikkhave, aṇḍajehi ca jalābujehi ca saṁsedajehi ca nāgehi opapātikā nāgā paṇītatarā.
analyzed: tatra bhikkhave aṇḍa jehi ca jalābu jehi ca saseda jehi ca nāgehi opapātikā nāgā paṇītatarā
translated: Among them, nāgas born from warmth and moisture and spontaneously born nāgas are finer than nāgas born from eggs, nāgas born from the womb, and nāgas born from warmth and moisture.🔽Among them, spontaneously born nāgas are finer than nāgas born from eggs, nāgas born from the womb, nāgas born from warmth and moisture, and nāgas born from the womb.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave catasso nāga yoniyaḥ ti  dutiya
translated: These are the four kinds of nāga wombs.”🔽The second section on nāgas is finished.

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ bhikkhu yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then a certain monk went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena m’idhekacce aṇḍajā nāgā uposathaṁ upavasanti vossaṭṭhakāyā ca bhavantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhekacce aṇḍa jāḥ nāgāḥ uposatham upavasanti vossaṭṭha kāyā ca bhavanti iti
translated: “What is the cause, Venerable Sir, what is the reason why some egg-born nāgas observe the observance day and have a purified livelihood?”

original: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekaccānaṁ aṇḍajānaṁ nāgānaṁ evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: idha bhikkhu ekaccānam aṇḍa jānam nāgānam evam hoti
translated: “Here, monk, some egg-born nāgas think,

original: ‘mayaṁ kho pubbe kāyena dvayakārino ahumha, vācāya dvayakārino, manasā dvayakārino.
analyzed: mayam kho pubbe kāyena dvaya kārinaḥ ahumha vācāya dvaya kārinaḥ manasā dvaya kārinaḥ
translated: ‘Formerly we acted in two ways with the body,

original: Te mayaṁ kāyena dvayakārino, vācāya dvayakārino, manasā dvayakārino, kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṁ nāgānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te mayam kāyena dvaya kārinaḥ vācāya dvaya kārinaḥ manasā dvaya kārinaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā aṇḍa jānam nāgānam sahabyatam upapannā
translated: We were double-dealers in thought, word, and deed. At the break-up of the body, after death, we were reborn among the egg-born nāgas.

original: Sacajja mayaṁ kāyena sucaritaṁ careyyāma, vācāya sucaritaṁ careyyāma, manasā sucaritaṁ careyyāma, evaṁ mayaṁ kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyyāma.
analyzed: sacajja mayam kāyena su caritam careyyāma vācāya su caritam careyyāma manasā su caritam careyyāma evam mayam kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyyāma
translated: If we were to do good by body, speech, and mind, then at the break-up of the body, after death, we would be reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Handa mayaṁ etarahi kāyena sucaritaṁ carāma, vācāya sucaritaṁ carāma, manasā sucaritaṁ carāmā’ti.
analyzed: handa mayam etarahi kāyena su caritam carāma vācāya su caritam carāma manasā su caritam carāma ati
translated: Let’s now do good by body, speech, and mind.’

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yena m’idhekacce aṇḍajā nāgā uposathaṁ upavasanti vossaṭṭhakāyā ca bhavantī”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 29.4
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhu hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce aṇḍa jāḥ nāgāḥ uposatham upavasanti vossaṭṭha kāyā ca bhavanti iti  tatiya  sayutta nikāya
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why some egg-born nāgas observe the uposatha and practice the code of conduct.”🔽The third section on the uposatha is finished.

translated: “What is the cause, lord, what is the reason why some newly reborn nāgas observe the uposatha and undertake the precepts, and their bodies become emaciated?”

original: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekaccānaṁ opapātikānaṁ nāgānaṁ evaṁ hoti:

original: ‘mayaṁ kho pubbe kāyena dvayakārino ahumha, vācāya dvayakārino, manasā dvayakārino.
analyzed: mayam kho pubbe kāyena dvaya kārinaḥ ahumha vācāya dvaya kārinaḥ manasā dvaya kārinaḥ
translated: ‘Formerly, we were bodily, verbally, and mentally engaged in misconduct.

original: Te mayaṁ kāyena dvayakārino, vācāya dvayakārino, manasā dvayakārino, kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā opapātikānaṁ nāgānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapannā.
analyzed: te mayam kāyena dvaya kārinaḥ vācāya dvaya kārinaḥ manasā dvaya kārinaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā opapātikānam nāgānam sahabyatam upapannā
translated: Because of misconduct by way of body, speech, and mind, when our bodies broke up, after death, we were reborn among nāgas reborn spontaneously.

original: Sacajja mayaṁ kāyena sucaritaṁ careyyāma, vācāya … manasā sucaritaṁ careyyāma, evaṁ mayaṁ kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyyāma.
analyzed: sacajja mayam kāyena su caritam careyyāma vācāya manasā su caritam careyyāma evam mayam kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyyāma
translated: But if we were now to engage in good bodily conduct, good verbal conduct, and good mental conduct, then because of good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, when our bodies break up, after death, we would be reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Handa mayaṁ etarahi kāyena sucaritaṁ carāma, vācāya … manasā sucaritaṁ carāmā’ti.
analyzed: handa mayam etarahi kāyena su caritam carāma vācāya manasā su caritam carāma ati
translated: Let’s now practice good conduct by way of body, speech, & mind.’

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yena m’idhekacce opapātikā nāgā uposathaṁ upavasanti vossaṭṭhakāyā ca bhavantī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhu hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce opapātikāḥ nāgāḥ uposatham upavasanti vossaṭṭha kāyā ca bhavanti iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why certain egg-born nāgas observe the uposatha, complete with its eight factors, and why they are reborn in good destinations, in heavenly worlds.”

translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn among the spontaneously born nāgas.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṁ paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā opapātikānaṁ nāgānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhu hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena midhā ekaccaḥ kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā opapātikānam nāgānam sahabyatam upapajjati iti
translated: This is the cause and reason why someone, with the breakup of the body, after death, is reborn among the spontaneously born nāgas.”

translated: “What is the cause, Bhante, what is the reason why someone, with the breakup of the body, after death, is reborn among the nāgas born from eggs?”

analyzed: saḥ annam deti
